comment.author: 25453448@N02
comment._content: ... in North Devon. There's no road down to here, only pedestrial walkways with steps.  The vehicle road stops at the top of the hill, where there's a car park.

comment._content: There is a road to the harbour,  but it goes down the back of the village.

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: Darkroom Daze, swanq and localsurfer:  Thanks for the information on this beautiful location. We will add North Devon to the description when we update.

comment.author: 25453448@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/55876399@N07] The North Devon (and West Somerset) coast is special (to Brits at least, and even by the standards of the beautiful coastline scenery of SW England). Much of the coast consists of high cliffs, and access to the shore is often limited to small winding lanes and roads, and some of it only accessible on foot or by boat.  So it is quite a 'secret' coast. For this reason it is relatively undeveloped and unspoilt, even 'wild', and the few holiday resorts are quite small. The SW England Coast Path now gives foot access to all of it.
